Title: Object: Si j'avais signé les traites de 1815, je me couperais le poign!..Et moi donc!
Series: Croquis a la manière noire; sujets philosophiques, populaires, moraux, politiques, critiques, civils, religieux et militaires 1840
Description: Plate no 11, an old soldier with a medal pointing to his fist, tells a young conscript: "if I had signed the treaties of 1815, I would cut off my fist!"; a low wall and trees in the background. 1840 Lithograph.
Producer name: Print made by: Nicolas Toussaint Charlet
Curator's comments: Part of an album published by Gihaut frères in 1840 and dedicated to the Bonapartist poet and song-writer Béranger. In original wrapper which incorporates a cover illustration (see La Combe 966); all lithographs are mounted on sheets of approximately the same size as the wrapper (545mm x 367mm).

According to Michael Driskel this print criticises the July Monarchy's reluctance to support Mehemet Ali of Egypt in war against Turkey (See Driskel, "Singing 'The Marseillaise' in 1840: The Case of Charlet's Censored Prints" in "Art Bulletin", December 1987, Vol XIX, no 4)
Bibliographic references: La Combe 1856 / Charlet, sa vie, ses lettres, suivi d'une description raisonné de son oeuvre lithographique (977)
Associated names: Associated with: Pierre Jean de Béranger (The series is dedicated to Béranger)
Associated events: Associated Event: Treaty of Paris (The treaty deprived France of territories conquered by Napoleon) 1815
Associated Event: "The Eastern Question" (See curatorial comment) 1839-1840
Acquisition name: Purchased through: A E Evans & Sons
